issue.title: world frame does not go with tf across network

content.raw:
@dan77062 I set up `ROS_IP` and `ROS_MASTER_URI` on the "field computer" that I was connecting to the "simulator" and that was enough to to `rostopic list` and echo the ros topics that aren't published by the ihmc java node. I had to take a further step and set `ROS_IP` and `ROS_MASTER_URI` on the simulator with the public IP address of the simulator (not `localhost` or `127.0.0.1`) before starting the simulator. It's confusing because rosjava resolves IP address differently than rospy or roscpp, so some of the topics will fail to send to the other machine, but that's because they are being sent by a rosjava node.

Also, I was able to reproduce the error saying `tf2.LookupException: "world" passed to lookupTransform argument target_frame does not exist.` but it was resolved after fixing the environment variables.
